Title:
Taxonomy and phylogeny of Auriculariaceae (Agaricomycetes,
Basidiomycota) with emphasis on corticioid taxa
Keywords:
Auriculariales; Eichleriella; Heterobasidiomycetes;
Heteroradulum; Tremellaceous fungi
Abstract:
The phylogeny and taxonomy of corticioid taxa in
Auriculariaceae were studied. Two new genera, eight new species and four
new combinations from east Asia are described or proposed based on
morphology and phylogenetic analyses of ITS and nrLSU sequence data. Of
them, Exidiella gen. nov. is erected for E. bambusicola (generic type)
and E. taiwanensis spp. nov. The genus differs from Exidia by its
resupinate basidiocarps and ellipsoid basidiospores, and formed a
lineage distant from Exidia glandulosa (generic type) in the
phylogenetic tree. Heterocorticium gen. nov. is established for H.
bambusicola (generic type) and H. latisporum spp. nov. The genus is
similar to Exidiopsis in microscope, but differs by having pigmented
coriaceous basidiocarps and forming a distinct lineage in the
phylogenetic tree. Eichleriella alpina, E. bambusicola, Heteroradulum
maolanensis and H. tropicum are described and illustrated as new.
Eichleriella delicata, E. roseola, E. sinensis and Heteroradulum
mussooriensis were combined from Heterochaete. Heteroradulum semis is
treated as a heterotypic synonym of H. mussooriensis. Authentic
specimens of Eichleriella chinensis were examined and determined to be
Stereum peculiar.
